caption: I was completely blown away by the rare minerals! This collection houses the best examples of many minerals that I have ever seen in person or in photos!

Awesome mineralogical collection, probably one of the best worldwide. I really like how minerals are organised (by chemistry/ type) and the dark room with well illuminated showcases is just perfection. Entrance fee is 6‚Ç¨/p (cheaper for students and children). You need to enter in Jussieu (Paris VI) and follow the sign in order to access the collection (ground floor). If you're in love with minerals, do not forget to visit the two others collections in Paris: the ones from Ecole des Mines and the one from natural history museum, a must see!

There's no overstating how insanely cool this collection is. Many of the specimens are the best-known on earth. Absolutely beautiful arrangement and scheme of display. Also, there's the crazy "radioactive stuff" room in the back corner. Not free but 100% worth the price. Lots of good food in the area also if you're not hanging around there.

It is a mineral museum in the Sorbonne University. It is not large, but you can see quite a few gemstones.  You can see how raw gemstones such as gold and ruby are, and in the form of stalactites or stalagmites as they are created. In addition, several pebbles and pieces of stone are available at low prices.  Please note that students of the Sorbonne can view it free of charge and you can have a discount if you have a ticket to the Mus√©e de Min√©ralogie, near the Luxembourg Park.

Beautifully displayed collection of rocks and minerals. The collection is outstanding and there are lots of interesting things to see - all the colors and shapes are amazing. Definitely worth a visit and there is a gift shop as well.
Very beautiful stones there! The only problem is that you have to go inside the campus to get there, by using one of the two entrances of the campus.
Very rare and unique collection. This place is the best ive visited. Big collection too. 3 to 4h trip
Great exposition!
Nice little cute museum, but a bit expensive for what they show
Impressive gallery!
Beautiful rocks

I was impressed to see minerals that are not easily seen in Japan. There aren't many people and it's not crowded, so you can enjoy it to your heart's content at your own pace. It would be even better if the entrance fee could be paid by touch and there was an explanation in English.  I was impressed by the minerals, which are not easily seen in Japan. There were not many people and it was not crowded, so I could enjoy it as much as I wanted at my own pace.

There are three places in Paris where you can see mineral and rock exhibitions, and this is one of them.  The view of this exhibition hall is very transparent. From any point here, you can see other parts of the room.  Of course, the stones and minerals on display here are all exquisite and lovely.  I don‚Äôt want to leave at all, I want to live here (laugh~

A truly exceptional collection. Really complete, I prefer it to that of the plant garden, you can really appreciate the great diversity of minerals which are superbly highlighted through the windows  A really warm welcome (thanks to the lady at reception who offered to keep my big backpack full of Asian food, she will recognize herself üòä)

Very nice museum, a hidden gem of Paris, no pun intended, the entrance is very discreet but if you like rocks, well, minerals they have an incredible collection in one single room.! Very dark inside, but you can appreciate the pieces exposed, be aware!  Main entrance is the university, easy to find just ask the students ;) and great welcome from the nice lady.  Great hidden gem museum in Paris, no pun intended, the entrance is very discreet if you like rocks, well minerals they have an incredible collection in one room.!  The main entrance is the main gate of the university, easy to find, just ask the students ;) and a great welcome, very low entrance price.

An undiscovered gem in Paris. Hidden in the basement next to the stairs is a beautiful collection of minerals and rocks. Here and there they look like jewels. A resting point in the city near the Jardin des Plantes or, for example, to dive into another world on a rainy day.

Superb collection, something to feast the eyes and remind us how superb planet Earth is!!! Pleasant welcome, the price includes a presentation CD of around a hundred minerals (out of the thousands present). Small shop with prices ranging from ‚Ç¨3 to ‚Ç¨150. Beautiful explanations of the shapes and chemical compositions of the stones. üëçüëçüëç ‚Ä¶
Very nice collection. Missing some explanations for the youngest
Sumptuous collection of gems! It's a real eye-catcher and the tutorials are very well done. A treat to visit urgently
Sublime minerals presented in excellent exhibition conditions. Staff also very friendly during my visit!

Complementary to the permanent exhibition of the natural history museum 5 minutes away on foot but no one talks about it... If the stones were better presented this exhibition would be a better huge collection. The tools are better presented here too.

Gorgeous! Many more specimens than in the other two mineral museums and more professional. Very beautiful. Lots of specimens with beautiful shapes and best quality. But the entrance is really difficult to find.

Very beautiful permanent exhibition of minerals. Exceptional pieces. This is not my first visit. An interesting theme on mining in Mexico until December 4. The place is calm and the minerals are well highlighted. Novice or expert, this place is for everyone. Payment by credit card is not possible.
The display cases are very organized, you can observe the minerals for hours here. The atmosphere is calm, perfect for concentrating.

Excellent museum and a ‚Äúbrilliant‚Äù temporary exhibition. The scenography is a pure marvel. From the moment you enter, it takes your eyes. The welcome is perfect. To visit and revisit ü•áü•áü•áü•áü•á ‚Ä¶

This museum is remarkable for its collection made up of some 1,400 rare pieces and for the promotion of minerals. Suitable for children, the youngest will be amazed by the colors and shapes of the minerals, others will satisfy their curiosity thanks to a very educational audio guide. Finally, the staff is very welcoming and dedicated. Thus, a young student in charge of reception advised my 10-year-old son on the choice of stones at the store. Former student of UPMC (1994!) I return to this place (Jussieu) with great pleasure, especially since with this museum the university highlights a rich cultural heritage. In short, I highly recommend this museum. Please note that following the vigipirate plan, entry is now from the main entrance located on rue Jussieu. Once on campus you have to go between plots 24 and 25.

One of the best collections of minerals in Paris, such as that of the School of Mines or that of the Jardin des Plantes. The way the minerals are displayed and the lighting helps to highlight them very well, and there is great variety. In the display cases surrounding the main room there are some technical details (extraction systems, chemical composition, crystallography, etc.). Perhaps the worst thing is the lack of publicity that this exhibition has always had. There is nothing at the entrance to the university campus to indicate that it exists.
Spectacular!!!!!! Whether or not you are interested in mineralogy it is a place to go. Even more so if you have kids (of any age). It's frankly surprising.
Very nice guided tour, interesting, magnificent! We learn, we discover.  To see and see again.
Impressive gallery open to the public. Various and colorful minerals. Interesting radioactive room.
A magnificent collection, entry is ‚Ç¨6

The collection is impressive! The welcome is friendly. In addition to the visit, there is a small shop where you can buy stones. Please note for the organization that everything must be paid in cash or by check, that it is closed in the morning and that the ticket allows access to the collection of the School of Mines. Interesting!

The showcase is polished to a shine, and the entire room is lined with minerals. There were also radioactive minerals, which was unusual. By the way, they also sell small minerals, postcards, and mineral books (in French). However, you will need to pay in cash, including the entrance fee of 6 euros (3 euros for students), so if you are purchasing minerals, you will want to bring as much as possible with you. There aren't many people, so you can take your time and look around.  To be honest, I would have liked an explanation in English as well.
It's really magnificent and free for Sorbonne university students
One of the most beautiful faces in the world for minerals, beautiful pieces displayed in highly visible display cases. Fascinating

Magnificent collection of minerals. The lighting highlights the many rooms well. We can regret the lack of explanations: we only find an introduction to crystallography but that's all. Little-known museum that is definitely worth the detour.

Hello magnificent minerals which dazzle the Vision and all the varieties and colors let us meditate on its beautiful rocks and very beautiful stone which act on our body, very clean and the welcome very good thank you cordially üëåüëåüëå
Be careful with vigipirate, entry is via the main entrance to the university: 4 place jussieu. One of the most beautiful collections of minerals in the world! It would be a shame to miss this.
